intro: Bupleurum cernuum, commonly known as lesser puncturewort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. It has a long flowering period, usually from late spring to early autumn, and is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of its genus.
